definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The prospector panned off bits of sand and gravel scooped from the bed of a stream.
sentences.chinese: 探礦者淘選從河牀中挖出的少量含金泥砂和沙礫。

sentences.english: He worked as a civil servant, gold prospector, reporter, lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是一名公務員，黃金探礦者，記者，講師。

sentences.english: And in violation of the treaty, prospectors entered the Indians' holy mountains.
sentences.chinese: 於是，探礦者們違反條約，闖入了印弟安人的聖山。

sentences.english: The prospector panned off bits of a sand and gravel scooped from the bed of a stream.
sentences.chinese: 探礦者淘選從河牀裏挖出的少量含金泥沙和砂礫。
